thread.title: Woman falls to death at dance party
thread.title_full: Woman falls to death at dance party

title: Woman falls to death at dance party
text:
Email a friend 
A BRISBANE woman has fallen to her death during a rooftop salsa dancing party in Turkey. 
Keshia Handa, 31, fell about 10 metres when a makeshift bridge connecting Istanbul’s Grand London Hotel with another building collapsed on Saturday night, killing her instantly, according to Turkish news reports. 
She had been dancing on the bridge about midnight when it gave way, English-language Turkish news agency BGN News reported. 
But Hurriyet Daily News reports that Ms Handa simply stepped on the bridge for fresh air when it collapsed. 
Ms Handa, a New Zealand citizen who was originally from Auckland, is believed to have been living and working as a psychologist in Brisbane for the past six years. Keshia Handa (far right) loved to dance, according to friends. Source: Facebook 
She had been holidaying in Turkey for two weeks and only days ago had checked into the Grand London Hotel, in Istanbul’s Beyoglu region, with friends to attend the dance party, which attracted more than 200 people. 
The dancing enthusiast often travelled the world to attend dance parties, friends told Hurriyet Daily News . 
Ms Handa’s former classmate, psychologist Mel Stephenson, told New Zealand’s NZME news agency her friend was “very popular” and a “genuinely beautiful person”. 
“She was just a delightful person — really warm and genuine and just very caring,” she said. 
“I just think sometimes bad things happen to good people.” 
The hotel’s owner Ibrahim Huzmeli told BGN News the event was an accident and staff were deeply saddened by the tragedy. 
Ms Handa’s family and New Zealand embassy officials arranged for her body to be returned to New Zealand. 
Turkish authorities are investigating the incident.
